results.title: Water: our problem
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, John Martin-Jones, Lee Robinson, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Illustrates our dependence on water and our inability to exist without it. Tells why Australia has water shortages and what is being done to irrigate the great inland tracts from mountainous regions of heavy snowfall and abundant rains. Australia has the largest artesian basin in the world, from which thousands of square miles have been made productive. Scientific progress has been made in the fields of rainmaking by chemical cloud dusting, and desalination of sea water.

results.title: Production unlimited
results.creator_credit: Robert Parker, R.V. Edwards and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Surveys the rapid development of Australian secondary industries, more than doubling output since 1939, with particular reference to the light engineering field.

results.title: Portrait of an Australian
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
The development of the myth of the “Typical Australian” of the old days. Myth, legend and romance embody our wishes, attitudes and beliefs. By using old illustrations, songs and ballads, this film traces the character which most Australians foster. The legend emerges from the convict past, the bitter struggles and hardships, the tradition of pioneer and explorer, the stormy gold rush days, the growth of towns and the gradually accepted fact that here were a new distinctive people who later joined together as one nation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Made in Australia
results.creator_credit: Chips Rafferty, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Protectionist economic policies during the Menzies era led to the development of a manufacturing industry in Australia. This document explores Australia’s steel industry, showing its relationship to other heavy industries and its development since the second world war.

results.title: Kondom Agaundo
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Outlines the background and life of Kondom Agaundo, a native leader elected to the Legislative Council as a representative of the people of the Highlands of Papua and New Guinea. Shows his family and tribal life; his leadership, nomination, election and first speech in the House where he tells of his desire to learn.

results.title: Doc: a Portrait of Herbert Vere Evatt, 1894-1965
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Denise Haslem, Film Australia, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and David McKnight
results.brief_description: Known as “the Doc”, Evatt was an idealist, internationalist, a lawyer and a politician. He was the only Australian elected as President of the United Nations (1948) and the decisions he handed down as a High Court Judge had lasting effects on the course of Australian political history. Evatt fought to defeat an attempt to ban the Communist Party, only to find that his own party, the Australian Labor Party was deeply divided on the issue and his contentious role in 1950’s politics overshadows his many notable achievements. This excellent documentary blends commentary, newsreel footage and interviews with historians, family and public figures to offer a rare and moving insight into the life of one of Australia’s most notable political figures.

results.title: Division of human tumor cells = Teilung von menschlichen tumorzellen
results.creator_credit: H. Lettre and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The film shows human tumour cells which have been removed from a patient with carcinoma of the stomach. The cells are contained in the ascitic fluid drawn off from the patient and are observed in this fluid for several hours after removal. A phase-contracts microscope is used with a magnification of 900 times. The conditions for the continued growth and division of the cells are not the most favourable and, in general, only preparations for divisions are observed. However, a normal cell division has been recorded and also a case of tetra-polar division. Silent, with captions in German.

results.title: Diving: no place for cowards
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The top of a ten-meter diving tower is no place for cowards, according to Jim Lambie, the vociferous coach of two of Canada’s top female divers, Janet Nutter and Linda Cuthbert. In this film we see what goes into making a champion performer and the complete faith and loyalty the athletes have towards Lambie despite his brusque manner. A highlight of the film is the close diving competition at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton.

results.title: Divided we stand
results.creator_credit: Rizu Hamid, Olga Edridge and BBC
results.brief_description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.
results.description: What was expected to be the formation of a “New Germany”, representing features of both the East and the West, has not occurred with re-unification. This program examines the problems and the disappointments that East Germans have had to confront since re-unification.

results.title: Divided trail: a Native American odyssey
results.brief_description: Uses archival footage and stills to document the beginnings of the American Indian protest movement in Chicago during the 1970s. Three leaders of the movement recount the events which motivated them to bring public attention to the plight of the American Indian, who has left the reservation with promises of employment and a better life only to find unemployment, slums and alcoholism.
